Making the web with JavaScript.

About Me

Hi, my name is Jeremy Fairbank, and I am a web developer. I enjoy working with JavaScript and Ruby, but I know my way around other languages. I like to build modular, scalable applications with reasonable abstraction to keep things DRY. I really enjoy helping and teaching others, especially about JavaScript.

Work

I work remotely on SimplyBuilt for an awesome company called Push (pushagency.io).

Open Source

I am a big fan of the Marionette.js framework for Backbone.js and am a core team member. Check out our repo at marionettejs/backbone.marionette.

I also have a few open source libraries on GitHub such as my component library for Marionette.js, jfairbank/marionette.component. You can view my GitHub profile here.

Conferences

Nodevember '14
Building Modular and Component Driven Architecture in Backbone.js and Marionette.js

I had the amazing honor to give my first developer talk at the inaugural Nodevember conference in Nashville, TN.

Besides Dev

Outside of web development I am a husband to my beautiful wife and a father to my son. I play guitar and sing at my church and believe I would be pretty messed up without the grace of God every day. I dabble in some photography and really enjoy jazz and chill electronic music.
